store.models module¶

class store.models.Category(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

This class is used to create Categories of the product. It has only one field “Name” and it and each object has it’s own assigned id from django.

This class is extended from the Model class so it has all the functionality of the model class.

this class is used to create objects for database entry has only one field called ‘name’

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.MultipleObjectsReturned

id¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

name¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>¶
product_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

class store.models.Customer(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

This class is used to create the Customers/Users.

This class is extended from the Model class so it has all the functionality of the model class.

This class is used to create objects for database entry

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>¶
order_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

shippingaddress_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

user¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Restaurant(Model):
    place = OneToOneField(Place, related_name='restaurant')

Restaurant.place is a ForwardOneToOneDescriptor instance.

user_id¶
class store.models.Order(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

This class is used to create Orders per user/customer. It has customer as it’s foreign key.

this class is used to create objects for database entry has fields named customer,date_ordered,complete,transaction_id

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

customer_id¶
date_ordered¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

property getCartItems¶

This Function is to get the number of items that are added in the cart by the user :param: self :return: ‘total’ number of items in the cart

property getCartTotal¶

— Returns the total amount for the cart total bill.

self : the object itself

total

The sum amount or the total amount of bill for all the items in the cart.

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

This class is extended from the Model class so it has all the functionality of the model class.

class store.models.Product(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

This class is used to create items or products.

This class is extended from the Model class so it has all the functionality of the model class.

this class is used to create objects for database entry has fields called name,price,digital(Shipping needed or not),image(Picture of the products),category

image¶

Just like the FileDescriptor, but for ImageFields. The only difference is assigning the width/height to the width_field/height_field, if appropriate.

property imageURL¶

This Function is to fetch the respective product image without gettting an error :param: self :return: url

store.urls module¶

store.views module¶

store.views.cart(request)¶

This method is used to display products that were added in the shopping cart in cart page. :param request: it’s a HttpResponse from user. :type request: HttpResponse. :return: this method returns a cart page which is a HTML page. :rtype: HttpResponse.

store.views.checkout(request)¶

This method is used to calculate and display the amount and products that is being purchased in checkout page. :param request: it’s a HttpResponse from user. :type request: HttpResponse. :return: this method returns a checkout page which is a HTML page. :rtype: HttpResponse.

store.views.loginPage(request)¶

This method is used to view the login page. :param request: it’s a HttpResponse from user. :type request: HttpResponse. :return: this method returns a search page which is a HTML page. :rtype: HttpResponse.

store.views.logoutUser(request)¶

This method is used to logout the user and redirect them to the login page. :param request: it’s a HttpResponse from user. :type request: HttpResponse. :return: this method returns a search page which is a HTML page. :rtype: HttpResponse.

store.views.processOrder(request)¶

This method is used to process all the products and complete transaction in checkout page. :param request: it’s a HttpResponse from user. :type request: HttpResponse. :return: this method returns a search page which is a HTML page. :rtype: JsonResponse.

store.views.registerPage(request)¶

This method is used to view the registration page. :param request: it’s a HttpResponse from user. :type request: HttpResponse. :return: this method returns a search page which is a HTML page. :rtype: HttpResponse.

store.views.searchBar(request)¶

This method is used to display all the products matching with the searh query in search page. :param request: it’s a HttpResponse from user. :type request: HttpResponse. :return: this method returns a search page which is a HTML page. :rtype: HttpResponse.

store.views.store(request)¶

This method is used to display all the products,category list, cart information in homepage page. :param request: it’s a HttpResponse from user. :type request: HttpResponse. :return: this method returns a store page which is a HTML page. :rtype: HttpResponse.

store.views.updateItem(request)¶

This method is used to add products to the shopping cart. :param request: it’s a HttpResponse from user. :type request: HttpResponse. :return: this method adds item to the cart and refreshes the HTML page. :rtype: HttpResponse.

store.views.viewall(request)¶

This method is used to display all the products in viewall page. :param request: it’s a HttpResponse from user. :type request: HttpResponse. :return: this method returns viewall page which is a HTML page. :rtype: HttpResponse.
